intro: Stylidium pilosum, commonly known as the hairy triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its unique trigger mechanism that aids in pollination. The plant produces vibrant red or orange flowers that attract insects, particularly bees and wasps. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its common name. Stylidium pilosum thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or open habitats.
